$Dave Philley batted out of order in Allie Clark's spot; Gus Zernial then doubled (out of turn); White Sox manager Paul Richards spoke with HP umpire Bill McKinley; the umpires read the rules and declared Cass Michaels out since he was the proper batter after Philley; Athletics manager Jimmy Dykes protested the game; 15 minute delay1952PHA.EVA.regular.comment.csv"
21 minute rain delay with 2-2 count on Mickey McDermott1952PHA.EVA.regular.comment.csv"
$Ray Murray dropped the wet ball, allowing Mickey McDermott to score1952PHA.EVA.regular.comment.csv"

$now raining extremely hard; Red Sox manager Lou Boudreau had been going out every half inning to plead with HP umpire Bill McGowan to call the game; Boudreau made two trips this time, and McGowan ordered the ground crew to spread sand on the mound and batter's boxes1952PHA.EVA.regular.comment.csv"
$the ball hit Dick Gernert's bat as he was ducking an inside pitch1952PHA.EVA.regular.comment.csv"

ej,hitcb101,P,mcgob901,Fighting ej,whits103,P,mcgob901,Field conditions $as Cass Michaels' double was clearing the bases, Sammy White had words with HP umpire Bill McGowan about his failure to call the game despite the horrible field conditions; McGowan ejected White; as White and McGowan argued, Billy Hitchcock was smiling as he came up to HP; White thought Hitchcock was laughing at him, and White took a swing at him; Hitchcock punched White, which led to a bench-clearing brawl Hitchcock ejected by McGowan1952PHA.EVA.regular.comment.csv"
